label: aldehyde Sakurai reaction
description: A carbon-carbon coupling reaction in which an aldehyde reacts with allyltrimethylsilane to form a homoallylic alcohol.

label: Beckmann rearrangement
description: A rearrangement where an oxime rearranges to form an amide. Often there is selective migration of one group.

label: Duff reaction
description: Formylation of a phenol or aromatic amine with hexamethylenetetramine in acidic conditions.

label: Mukaiyama aldol condensation
description: An aldol condensation between an aldehyde or ketone and a silyl enol ether (also known as a ketene silyl acetal) to give a beta-hydroxy carbonyl compound.

label: Hiyama coupling
description: A carbon-carbon coupling reaction where an organosilane reacts with an organic halide or triflate. It is catalysed by a palladium or nickel complex.

label: Willgerodt-Kindler reaction
description: The conversion of an aryl alkyl ketone to an amide using sulfur and dry ammonia or a primary or secondary amine. The amide carbonyl group is always at the end of the alkyl chain.

label: Auwers synthesis
description: Ring expansion of a 2-bromo-2-(alpha-bromobenzyl)-1-benzofuran to a flavonol in alcoholic alkali.

label: retro-Diels-Alder reaction
description: The reverse of a [4+2] cycloaddition reaction, in which an unsaturated six-membered ring compound fragments to give a diene and a compound containing a double or triple bond (a dienophile).

label: Perkin reaction
description: An aldol condensation where an aryl aldehyde reacts with an acid anhydride to form a cinnamic acid.

label: acetate protection
description: A hydroxyl group protection where the hydroxyl oxygen atom is protected by formation of an acetate ester.

label: Mannich reaction
description: A carbon-carbon coupling reaction where ammonia or an amine reacts with a non-enolisable aldehyde, often methanal, and an enolisable carbonyl compound to form a beta-amino carbonyl compound.

label: Allan-Robinson flavone synthesis
description: Reaction of ortho-hydroxyaryl ketones with aromatic carboxylic acid anhydrides to yield a flavone.

label: deprotection objective
description: A functional modification objective that is satisfied by deprotecting some functional group.

label: Nef reaction
description: The conversion of a primary nitroalkane or secondary nitroalkane to an aldehyde or ketone, respectively.

label: Koerner-Contardi reaction
description: An aromatic substitution reaction where an aryl diazonium salt reacts with a copper(II) halide to form an aromatic halide.

label: hydroalumination
description: The reaction of an aluminium alkyl with an alkene, to give an intermediate aluminium species that can give various products after work-up.

label: oxa-Pictet-Spengler reaction
description: Cyclisation-condensation of a beta-arylethanol with an aldehyde to yield an ortho-,peri-fused aryl-oxacycle.

label: intramolecular acyloin condensation
description: A reductive coupling reaction between two ester groups in the same molecule to give an acyloin (an alpha-hydroxyketone).

label: Castro-Stephens coupling
description: Palladium-catalysed coupling of copper(I) acetylides with aryl halides to yield arylacetylenes.

label: Cadiot-Chodkiewicz coupling
description: A coupling reaction between a terminal alkyne and an alkynyl halide catalysed by Cu(I) salts.

label: amide reduction to amine
description: A reduction process where an amide is transformed into an amine.

label: Chan-Lam coupling
description: Arylation of an amine or an alcohol with an arylboronic acid, stannane or siloxane in air with a copper acetate catalyst.

label: Parham cyclisation
description: Reaction of a bromoarene that has an electrophilic group at the para-position with lithium bromide or lithium iodide followed by intramolecular cyclisation to yield a fused-ring system.

label: Finkelstein reaction
description: The conversion of an alkyl chloride, alkyl bromide or alkyl sulfonate ester to an alkyl iodide by SN2 substitution. The reaction relies upon the equilibrium being pushed to completion by the precipitation.

label: Tsuji-Trost reaction
description: A carbon-carbon coupling reaction in which a nucleophile reacts with an allyl acetate, allyl halide, allyl carbonate, allyl carbamate, allyl phosphate, allyl sulfone or allyl nitro compound to give an allyl compound. The reaction is catalsed by Pd(0).

label: Stevens rearrangement, ammonium
description: The 1,2-rearrangement of an alpha-methylene ammonium salt to an amine in the presence of strong base.

label: copper(I)-catalyzed azide-alkyne cycloaddition
description: A [3+2] cycloaddition reaction between an azide and an alkyne to give a 1,2,3-triazole as a single regioisomer.

label: Tiffeneau-Demjanov rearrangement
description: Rearrangement of a beta-amino alcohol to yield a carbonyl compound. In the first step the amine is diazotised by reaction with nitrous acid.

label: Ugi reaction
description: Reaction of a ketone or aldehyde, amine, an isocyanide and carboxylic acid to form a bisamide.

label: Friedel-Crafts alkylation
description: A carbon-carbon coupling reaction between an arene and an alkyl halide/alkene/alcohol (anything that can form a carbocation) to give a substituted arene. The reaction is catalysed by a Lewis acid.

label: functional reduction objective
description: A functional group modification objective that is satisfied by a reaction in which a functional group is reduced.

label: Katritzky pyrylium-pyridinium method
description: The substitution of an amine with a nucleophile using a pyrylium salt.

label: heteroaryl reduction to saturated heterocycle
description: A hydrogenation reaction where a heteroaryl is reduced to a saturated heterocycle.

label: end-of-chain chain shortening objective
description: A molecular skeleton transformation objective that is satisfied by a reaction in which a single skeletal atom is removed from the end of a chain.

label: alkene metathesis
description: A joining reaction in which two carbon-carbon double bonds are redistributed among two fragments, i.e. two alkenes. It is typically catalysed by a metal carbenoid, and proceeds via two four-membered intermediates (metallacyclobutanes). The reaction is driven by release of a low-MW alkene.

label: Hofmann elimination
description: The elimination of a methylated amine from an alkylamine to form an olefin. The reaction proceeds via the quaternary ammonium salt.

label: aromatic Claisen rearrangement
description: The [3,3]-sigmatropic rearrangement, and subsequent re-aromatisation, of an allyl aryl ether to give an ortho-allyl phenol.

label: fused-ring-system formation objective
description: A molecular transformation objective that is satisfied by a reaction in which a fused ring system is present in a product that was not present in any of the reactants.

label: Brook rearrangement
description: The rearrangement of an alpha-, beta- or gamma-hydroxy silane to give a silyl ether. It is catalysed by a base.

label: Weerman reaction
description: The degradation of an alpha-hydroxy amide or an alpha,beta-unsaturated amide to the lower homologue aldehyde, especially in carbohydrate chemistry. The process proceeds via Hofmann degradation.

label: Bartoli indole synthesis
description: Reaction of an ortho-substituted nitroarene with a vinyl Grignard reagent to yield a 7-substituted indole.

label: molecular extrusion objective
description: A molecular transformation objective that is satisfied by a cleaving reaction in which a skeletal atom or group of atoms is removed from the middle of a molecule.

label: Myers-Saito cyclisation
description: Cyclization of a enynyl allene to yield a toluene biradical with radical centres on the methyl group and at the meta position.

label: reductive imination
description: A functional group modification where a carbonyl oxygen is replaced by an imine.

label: allylic oxidation
description: An oxidation reaction where an allylic C-H bond is replaced by a C=O bond.

label: Sandmeyer isonitrosoacetanilide isatin synthesis
description: Reaction of aniline, hydroxylamine and chloral hydrate to form an aniline intermediate followed by cyclization in acid and hydrolysis to yield isatin.

label: Cadogan indole synthesis
description: A Cadogan cyclization that results in an indole.

label: imine Sakurai reaction
description: A carbon-carbon coupling reaction in which an imine reacts with allyltrimethylsilane to form a homoallylic amine.

label: Fischer-Tropsch process
description: A process in which carbon monoxide and hydrogen ('syngas') are converted into various liquid hydrocarbons.

label: Cadogan indole synthesis
description: A Cadogan cyclization that results in an indole.

label: Madelung indole synthesis
description: Reaction of an N-(2-alkylphenyl)alkanamide with strong base to form an indole.

label: Achmatowicz rearrangement
description: A rearrangement of a furfuryl alcohol derivative to a dihydropyranone, from which monosaccharides may be synthesised.

label: Bergmann degradation
description: Removal of a terminal amino acid residue from a peptide by benzoylation, azidation, treatment with benzyl alcohol, hydrogenation and hydrolysis.

label: Chichibabin reaction
description: Reaction of an azacycle with an alkali-metal amide to yield an aminated azacycle.

label: amide to imidoyl chloride conversion
description: A functional group modification where an amide is converted to an imidoyl chloride.

label: Simmons-Smith reaction
description: A ring formation reaction where an alkene reacts with a dihalomethane in the presence of a metal atom or metal complexes to form a cyclopropane. The traditional reaction uses a zinc-copper couple and diiodomethane.

label: Bradsher reaction
description: Reaction of an ortho-acyldiarylmethane, catalysed by acid, to yield an anthracene.

label: Sakurai reaction, acid chloride
description: A carbon-carbon coupling reaction in which an acid chloride reacts with allyltrimethylsilane to form a gamma,delta-unsaturated ketone.

label: Noyori asymmetric hydrogenation, alkene
description: The homogeneous asymmetric catalytic hydrogenation of a C=C double bond using a ruthenium(II) BINAP catalyst.

label: Elbs persulfate oxidation, tolyl variant
description: The oxidation of a methyl-substituted aromatic compound to the corresponding benzaldehyde using potassium persulfate.

label: Sharpless asymmetric aminohydroxylation
description: The aminohydroxylation of an alkene to give a beta-amino alcohol, with control of absolute stereochemistry at the two new stereocentres. The oxidising agent is an oxygen-containing osmium species and/or an amino derivative which can be used catalytically with a stoichiometric oxidant and a chiral ligand.

label: Cope rearrangement
description: A [3,3]-sigmatropic rearrangement where a 1,5-hexadiene rearranges to form a 1,5-hexadiene.

label: Auwers synthesis
description: Ring expansion of a 2-bromo-2-(alpha-bromobenzyl)-1-benzofuran to a flavonol in alcoholic alkali.

label: Knoevenagel condensation
description: A carbon-carbon coupling reaction of an aldehyde and a methylene compound.

label: Paal-Knorr pyrrole synthesis
description: The cyclisation of a 1,4-dicarbonyl compound with an amine to give a pyrrole.

label: Barton decarboxylation
description: The decarboxylation of a carboxylic acid to the lower homologue alkane using a pyridine thione.

label: Crabbé homologation
description: Oxidation of an alkene to an allene by heating with formaldehyde, an amine and an inorganic salt.

label: Nicholas reaction, nucleophilic heteroatom centre
description: The reaction of a propargylic cation (stabilised with dicobalt octacarbonyl) with a hydride or amine or enamine to give a substituted alkyne.

label: phthalimide protection
description: Protection of a primary amino group by reaction with phthalic anhydride.

label: Eglinton reaction
description: A coupling reaction between two molecules of a terminal alkyne using stoichiometric Cu(II) salts.

label: Luche reduction
description: The chemoselective reduction of an enone to give an allylic alcohol, using sodium borohydride and an lanthanoid chloride, typically cerium chloride.

label: Krapcho decarboxylation
description: Reaction of an ester with an electron-withdrawing group alpha- to the ester functionality with a metal halide or pseudohalide to yield the shorter homologous system.

label: hydrozirconation
description: The reaction of a organozirconium hydride with an alkene or alkyne, to give an intermediate zirconium species that can give various products after work-up. The zirconium reagent used is typically Schwartz's reagent, Cp2ZrHCl.

label: imine reduction to amine
description: A reduction reaction where an imine function is replaced by an amine.

label: Demko-Sharpless reaction
description: A functional group modification of a nitrile to a 1H-tetrazole by addition of sodium azide.

label: Chapman rearrangement
description: Rearrangement of an aryl imino ether to yield an N,N-diaryl amide.

label: Doebner reaction
description: The reaction between an aromatic amine, an aldehyde and pyruvic acid on heating to give a quinoline 4-carboxylic acid (cinchoninic acid).

label: pivaloyl protection
description: Protection of a hydroxy group by reaction with pivaloyl chloride, resulting in formation of a pivaloyl ester.

label: Bamberger rearrangement
description: Rearrangement of an N-phenylhydroxamine in acid to yield a para-aminophenol.

label: Sugasawa reaction
description: Reaction of an aniline with a nitrile in the presence of boron trichloride and a Lewis acid to yield an ortho-acylated aniline.

label: Johnson-Claisen rearrangement
description: The coupling and subsequent [3,3]-sigmatropic rearrangement of an allylic alcohol and trimethyl orthoacetate to give a gamma,delta-unsaturated alkyl ester.

label: Pechmann pyrazole synthesis
description: Reaction of an organic diazo compound with an acetylene to yield a pyrazole.

label: azo coupling
description: A coupling reaction of a diazonium salt with a phenol or aniline to give an azo compound.

label: Peterson olefination
description: A carbon-carbon coupling reaction in which an alpha-silyl carbanion reacts with an aldehyde or a ketone to give an alkene, proceeding via a beta-hydroxysilane. The stereochemistry of the alkene can be controlled by treating the intermediate with acid or base.

label: Claisen rearrangement
description: The [3,3]-sigmatropic rearrangement of an allyl vinyl ether to give a gamma,delta-unsaturated carbonyl compound.

label: Luche reaction
description: A carbon-carbon coupling reaction where an aldehyde or ketone reacts with an allyl halide and zinc to give a homoallylic alcohol.

label: 3-aza-Cope rearrangement
description: The rearrangement of a 3-aza-1,5-hexadiene to form a delta,epsilon-unsaturated imine.

label: Seyferth-Gilbert ketone homologation
description: Reaction of a ketone with a dimethyl diazomethyl phosphonate under basic conditions to yield a terminal alkyne.

label: Leuckart-Wallach reaction
description: The reductive amination of ketones or aldehydes with an amine and formic acid to form amines.

label: Prilezhaev epoxidation
description: Epoxidation of an alkene by reaction with a peroxy acid.

label: Demjanov rearrangement
description: Substitution reaction of a primary amine via deazotisation to yield a mixture of the corresponding primary alcohol and secondary alcohol.

label: benzylic oxidation
description: An oxidation reaction where a carbon centre bonded to the benzene ring is oxidized to a carboxyl group.

label: Collins oxidation
description: Oxidation of a primary alcohol with a pyridine-chromium trioxide complex in dichloromethane to yield an aldehyde.

label: Henry reaction
description: A carbon-carbon coupling reaction between a nitroalkane and an aldehyde or ketone to give a beta-hydroxy nitroalkane.

label: Wittig methylenation
description: A carbon-carbon coupling reaction where a carbonyl compound reacts with a phosphonium ylide to give a terminal alkene.

label: Meyer-Schuster rearrangement
description: Rearrangement of a propargyl alcohol to an alpha,beta-unsaturated carbonyl compound via an allene intermediate to yield the gamma-substituted product.

label: Curtius rearrangement
description: A rearrangement of an acyl azide to give an isocyanate by pyrolysis, with the elimination of molecular nitrogen.

label: Mukaiyama-Hoshino method
description: Reaction of a primary nitro compound with phenyl isocynatate and triethylamine to yield a nitrile oxide.

label: Julia-Kocienski olefination
description: A carbon-carbon coupling reaction between a tetrazole sulfone and an aldehyde or ketone to give a (typically trans) alkene.

label: Ramberg-Backlund reaction
description: The reaction of an alpha-halosulfone to give an alkene, with the extrusion of sulfur dioxide.

label: Dakin reaction
description: The reaction of ortho- or para-phenolic (or ortho- or para-anilinic) aldehydes or ketones with hydrogen peroxide to form bisphenols (or hydroxy anilines) and carboxylic acids.

label: Buchwald-Hartwig amination
description: A reaction in which an aryl halide or aryl triflate reacts with a primary or secondary amine in the presence of base to give a secondary or tertiary amine. It is catalysed by a palladium catalyst.

label: Beirut reaction
description: Reaction of a benzofurazan 1-oxide with an enamine or enolate to yield a quinoxaline-1,4-dioxide.

label: aza-ene reaction
description: A joining reaction where an N=C system with an allylic hydrogen reacts with a compound containing a multiple bond (an enophile) to form a substituted alkene.

label: planned synthesis
description: An experimental procedure with the aim of producing a portion of a given compound or mixture.

label: Prins reaction
description: A carbon-carbon coupling between formaldehyde and an alkene to give a 1,3-diol or an allylic alcohol, catalysed by acid.

label: Sandmeyer diphenylurea isatin synthesis
description: Reaction of diphenylthiourea with lead carbonate and potassium cyanide to form a cyanoformidine followed by ring closure and acid hydrolysis to yield isatin.

label: Vilsmeier-Haack reaction
description: A formylation of an activated arene with a disubstituted formamide to give an aryl carboxaldehyde.

label: [2,3]-Wittig rearrangement
description: A base-mediated 2,3-sigmatropic rearrangement of an allyl ether to give a homoallylic alcohol.

label: Doebner-Miller reaction
description: The formation of a quinoline from a primary aromatic amine and an alpha,beta-unsaturated carbonyl compound.

label: Beckmann fragmentation
description: The cleavage of an oxime to the corresponding nitrile and an alkyl halide. This reaction is related to the Beckmann rearrangement, and occurs when the R group that is anti to the oxime hydroxyl is quaternary.

label: Fmoc protection
description: The protection of an amine (often a peptide) as its 9H-fluoren-9-ylmethoxycarbonyl derivative.

label: Krapcho decarboxylation
description: Reaction of an ester with an electron-withdrawing group alpha- to the ester functionality with a metal halide or pseudohalide to yield the shorter homologous system.

label: crossed Cannizzaro reaction
description: The reaction between two different non-enolisable aldehydes to give a carboxylic acid and an alcohol. The reaction is base-catalysed.

label: molecular ring contraction objective
description: A molecular skeleton transformation objective that is satisfied by a reaction where an existing ring is reduced in size.

label: Eastwood reaction
description: Reaction of a 1,2-diol with triethoxymethane under heat to yield an olefin.

label: Fenton reaction
description: Either: (a) The oxidation of a 1,2-glycol with Fenton's reagent (hydrogen peroxide and iron salts) to give an alpha-hydroxy aldehyde;  (b) The oxidation of an alpha-hydroxy carboxylic acid with Fenton's reagent to give an alpha-keto carboxylic acid; or (c) the reaction of the components of Fenton's reagent, viz. reduction of hydrogen peroxide by Fe(II) , producing an hydroxyl radical.

label: Eschenmoser-Claisen rearrangement
description: The coupling and subsequent [3,3]-sigmatropic rearrangement of an allylic alcohol and alpha,alpha-dialkoxy ethylamine to give a gamma,delta-unsaturated dialkyl amide.

label: ethyl ester deprotection
description: A deprotection reaction where the reactant is an ethyl ester and the product is a carboxylic acid.

label: Wacker process
description: The oxidation of ethene to acetaldehyde, catalysed by PdCl2 and CuCl2, and using molecular oxygen as the oxidant.

label: Hofmann rearrangement
description: Rearrangement of a primary carboxylic amide to an isocyanate.

label: Sarett primary alcohol oxidation
description: Oxidation of a primary alcohol with a pyridine-chromium trioxide complex to yield an aldehyde.

label: phthalimide deprotection
description: Conversion of a phthalimide into the corresponding primary amine.

label: Gattermann reaction
description: The formylation of an arene with hydrogen cyanide to give an aryl aldehyde or ketone.

label: Baudisch reaction
description: Copper-catalysed reaction of benzene with a nitrosylating agent and hydrogen peroxide to form an o-nitrosophenol.

label: ring-opening metathesis polymerisation
description: A joining reaction in which two carbon-carbon double bonds are redistributed among two fragments, i.e. two alkenes. It is typically catalysed by a metal carbenoid, and proceeds via two four-membered intermediates (metallacyclobutanes). The reaction is driven by release of ring strain in the cycloalkene.

label: [1,2]-Wittig rearrangement
description: A base-mediated 1,2-sigmatropic rearrangement of an ether to give an alcohol.

label: Baeyer-Villiger oxidation
description: A reaction of a ketone to give an ester, in which an alkyl, benzyl or phenyl group migrates from one of the alpha-carbon centres to an adjacent oxygen, displacing an oxygen-based leaving group; the result is a formal insertion of an oxygen atom. The reaction also works with aldehydes, giving the corresponding carboxylic acid. The term "Baeyer-Villiger rearrangement" may occasionally be used in a mechanistic sense to refer specificially to the actual rearrangement step.

label: alkyne reduction to alkane
description: A hydrogenation reaction where an alkyne is reduced to an alkane.

label: Ferrier rearrangement
description: The rearrangement of an O-alkenyl acetal to give the corresponding beta-alkoxy carbonyl compound.

label: Bradsher cyclisation
description: Diels-Alder reaction of a dienophile with a cationic aromatic azadiene to yield a bridged-ring system.

label: Jones oxidation
description: An oxidation reaction where an alcohol is oxidized to the corresponding carbonyl compound by a dichromate ion.

label: acetoacetic ester synthesis
description: A carbon-carbon coupling reaction between a beta-ketoester and an alkyl halide to yield an alpha-alkylated ester.

label: Fischer indole synthesis
description: Reaction of an aldehyde or ketone with a phenylhydrazine to give an indole.

label: Eglinton reaction
description: A coupling reaction between two molecules of a terminal alkyne using stoichiometric Cu(II) salts.

label: Williamson ether synthesis
description: The reaction between an alkyl halide or alkyl sulfate and a metal alkoxide to give an ether.

label: Eschweiler-Clarke methylation
description: N-methylation of a primary or secondary amine with formic acid and formaldehyde to yield a tertiary amine.

label: Clemmensen reduction
description: A functional group reduction where an aldehyde or ketone carbonyl group is reduced to a methylene with zinc-mercury amalgam and hydrochloric acid.

label: Zimmermann reaction
description: The reaction between a methylene ketone and a polynitro aromatic compound.

label: nickel-catalysed Kumada coupling
description: A cross-coupling reaction between a Grignard reagent and an activated (aryl or vinyl) halide or triflate. The reaction is catalysed by a nickel catalyst.

label: intramolecular Heck reaction
description: A carbon-carbon coupling reaction where an organohalide or triflate couples to an alkene in the same molecule, catalysed by palladium.

label: Bénary reaction
description: Reaction of a beta-aminovinylketone with a Grignard reagent to yield a substituted alpha,beta-unsaturated carbonyl compound.

label: Lossen rearrangement
description: The derivatisation (for example with tosyl chloride) and subsequent rearrangement of a hydroxamic acid to give an isocyanate.

label: Paal-Knorr thiophene synthesis
description: The cyclisation of a 1,4-dicarbonyl compound with phosphorus pentasulfide to give a thiophene.

label: Seyferth-Gilbert ketone homologation
description: Reaction of a ketone with a dimethyl diazomethyl phosphonate under basic conditions to yield a terminal alkyne.

label: Amadori rearrangement
description: Rearrangement of an aldose N-glycoside to a ketose N-glycoside by acid or base catalysis.

label: Castro-Stephens coupling
description: Palladium-catalysed coupling of copper(I) acetylides with aryl halides to yield arylacetylenes.

label: molecular chain lengthening objective
description: A molecular skeleton joining adjective that is satisfied by a chain part of a molecular skeleton being lengthened.

label: hydrostannylation
description: The reaction of a organotin hydride with an alkene or alkyne, to give an intermediate tin species that can give various products after work-up.

label: Sarett secondary alcohol oxidation
description: Oxidation of a secondary alcohol with a pyridine-chromium trioxide complex to yield a ketone.

label: nitro reduction to amine
description: A reduction reaction where a nitro group is reduced to an amino group.

label: Elbs persulfate oxidation, phenol variant
description: The oxidation of a phenol to give a (predominantly para) diphenol using potassium persulfate.

label: Sandmeyer pseudohalogenation
description: An aromatic substitution reaction where an aryl diazonium salt reacts with a copper(II) pseudohalide to form an aromatic pseudohalide.

label: intramolecular Prins reaction
description: A reaction between formaldehyde and an alkene to give a 1,3-dioxane, catalysed by acid.

label: Stork-Crabtree hydrogenation
description: A hydrogenation in which a metal-ligating group distant from the reacting alkene directs the attack of hydrogen, giving preferentially one stereoisomer of the product.

label: Pinner triazine synthesis
description: Reaction of aryl amidines or halogenated aliphatics amidines with phosgene to yield a 2-hydroxy-4,6-diaryl-s-triazine with loss of ammonia.

label: Bernthsen acridine synthesis
description: Reaction of a diarylamine in an organic acid or anhydride in the presence of zinc chloride to yield a 9-substituted acridine.

label: Cativa process
description: The reaction of formaldehyde with methanol to form acetic acid, catalysed by an iridium complex.

label: Kharasch-Sosnovsky reaction
description: The allylic oxidation of an alkene with a peroxy ester or a peroxide to give the corresponding allylic alcohol derivative. The catalyst is a copper compound.

label: Carroll rearrangement
description: An adaptation of the Claisen rearrangement that transforms a beta-keto allyl ester into a gamma,delta-allyl ketone. It uses base and high temperature or milder conditions with a ruthenium or palladium complex as catalyst.

label: amide reduction to amine
description: A reduction process where an amide is transformed into an amine.

label: Camps quinoline synthesis
description: Cyclisation of an o-acylaminoacetophenone in alcoholic sodium hydroxide to form a substituted hydroxyquinoline.

label: Boord olefin synthesis
description: Etherification of an aldehyde followed by bromination and reaction with a Grignard reagent followed by treatment with zinc to eliminate the halogen and alkoxy groups to produce an olefin.

label: Wurtz reaction
description: A carbon-carbon homocoupling reaction of two molecules of an alkyl halide with sodium to give a symmetrical product.

label: Sakurai reaction, enone
description: A carbon-carbon coupling reaction in which an enone reacts with allyltrimethylsilane to form a delta,epsilon-unsaturated carbonyl compound.

label: Appel chlorination
description: Conversion of an alcohol to an alkyl chloride with triphenylphosphine and tetrachloromethane.

label: silyl protection
description: A hydroxyl group protection where the hydroxyl oxygen atom is protected by formation of a silyl ether.

label: Dess-Martin oxidation
description: The oxidation of a primary alcohol to an aldehyde or a secondary alcohol to a ketone using the Dess-Martin periodinane.

label: Arbuzov reaction
description: The alkylation of a trialkyl phosphite with an alkyl halide or acyl halide to give an alkyl phosphonate.

label: Steglich rearrangement
description: The rearrangement of an oxazolyl carbonate to a C-carboxyazlactone.

label: Kröhnke pyridine synthesis
description: Condensation of a 1,5-diketone with ammonium acetate in acetic acid to form a pyridine.

label: Paternò–Büchi reaction
description: A photochemical cycloaddition between an aldehyde or ketone and an alkene to give an oxetane.

label: Woehler reaction
description: The formation of urea from ammonium cyanate. Ammonium cyanate is unstable, and so is formed in situ from either (a) cyanic acid and ammonia, (b) a metal cyanate and an ammonium salt, or (c) a metal cyanate and ammonia.

label: aza-Wittig reaction
description: Reaction of a carbonyl compound with a phosphazene to give an imine.

label: Smith indole synthesis
description: Reaction of a N-(2-alkylphenyl)-trimethylsilylamine with two equivalents of organolithium and an ester or carboxylic acid to form an indole.

label: aza-Baylis-Hillman reaction
description: A carbon-carbon coupling of an imine to an activated alkene in the presence of a nucleophilic base to give an allylic amine.

label: Newman-Kwart rearrangement
description: Rearrangement of an O-aryl thiocarbamate to an S-aryl thiocarbamate by migration of the aryl group.

label: Mori-Ban indole synthesis
description: An intramolecular Heck reaction of an ortho-halo-aniline with an alkene, catalysed by palladium.

label: tert-butyl protection
description: A carboxy group protection where the product is a tert-butyl ester.

label: Collins oxidation
description: Oxidation of a primary alcohol with a pyridine-chromium trioxide complex in dichloromethane to yield an aldehyde.

label: Skraup reaction
description: A condensation between an aromatic amine and glycerol to give a quinoline.

label: 2-aza-Cope rearrangement
description: The rearrangement of a 2-aza-1,5-hexadiene to form an imine.

label: Negishi coupling
description: A carbon-carbon coupling reaction between an organohalide or organotriflate and an organozinc compound. The reaction is catalysed by palladium or nickel.

label: Heck reaction
description: A carbon-carbon coupling reaction where an organohalide or triflate couples to a terminal olefin to produce an internal olefin, catalysed by palladium. It is stereospecific.

label: ketone Sakurai reaction
description: A carbon-carbon coupling reaction in which a ketone reacts with allyltrimethylsilane to form a homoallylic alcohol.

label: Schmittel cyclisation
description: Cyclization of a enynyl allene to yield a 1-methyl-5-methylenecyclopenta-1,3-diene biradical with radical centres on the methyl group and methylene group.

label: Wohl-Ziegler bromination
description: The allylic or benzylic bromination of hydrocarbons using an N-bromoimide and a radical initiator, to give an allylic or benzylic bromide.

label: Gabriel synthesis
description: The reaction of primary alkyl halides with sodium or potassium phthalimide, followed by hydrolysis, to give the corresponding primary amine.

label: thermal hydrosilylation
description: The thermally induced addition of a hydrosilane across the double bond of an alkene or alkyne to give a more substituted silane, usually applied to cases where the hydrosilane is part of a silicon surface.

label: Arens-van Dorp synthesis
description: Reaction of a ketone with ethoxyacetylene to form an alkoxyethynyl alcohol.

label: aryl reduction to cycloalkyl
description: A hydrogenation reaction where an aryl ring is reduced to a cycloalkyl ring.

label: Dimroth rearrangement
description: A rearrangement of a heterocyclic compound in which endocyclic and exocyclic heteroatoms swap places.

label: functional group addition objective
description: A functional modification objective that is satisfied by a reaction in which a covalent bond is formed between the molecular skeleton and a functional group and where the skeletal bond order is unchanged.

label: Passerini reaction
description: The reaction between an isonitrile, a carboxylic acid and aldehyde or ketone to give an alpha-acyloxy amide.

label: Reimer-Tiemann reaction
description: A formylation reaction between an aromatic compound (for example, phenol, pyrrole or indole) and chloroform (for example, to form an ortho-formyl phenol).

label: Glaser coupling
description: A coupling reaction between two molecules of a terminal alkyne catalysed by Cu(I) salts.

label: Hunsdiecker reaction
description: The decarboxylation of silver carboxylates with halogens to give organic halides.

label: Schotten-Baumann reaction
description: The coupling of an alcohol or amine with an acyl chloride to give an ester or amide. A two-phase solvent system is often used, to enable the acid generated during the reaction to be neutralised by the aqueous base, while the starting materials and products remain in the organic phase.

label: Pfitzinger reaction
description: The reaction between isatin and an alpha-methylene carbonyl compound to give a substituted quinoline-4-carboxylic acid.

label: Pinner reaction
description: A functional group modification where a nitrile reacts with an alcohol under acid catalysis to form an amidine or ester.

label: Leuckart ketone reaction
description: Reductive amination of a ketone with ammonium formate or formamide to form an amine.

label: benzylamine deprotection
description: An amino group deprotection reaction where a benzylamine group is removed by hydrogenation.

label: Benkeser reduction
description: Addition of hydrogen atoms to unsaturated rings by means of alkali metals in low-molecular weight amines.

label: Petasis reaction
description: The alkylation of an amine with a boronic acid and an aldehyde to give a substituted amine.

label: Wallach degradation
description: Favorskii rearrangement of a cyclic alpha-dibromoketone followed by decarboxylation to yield a ring-contracted cyclic ketone.

label: Paal-Knorr furan synthesis
description: The cyclisation of a 1,4-dicarbonyl compound with an acid catalyst to give a furan.

label: Cadogan carbazole synthesis
description: The reduction of a 2-nitrobiaryl compound to give a carbazole.

label: Dieckmann cyclisation
description: An intramolecular cyclisation of a diester to give a cyclic beta-ketoester.

label: Pictet-Spengler reaction
description: A condensation-cyclisation of a beta-phenethylamine with an aldehyde to give a tetrahydroisoquinoline.

label: Schmidt rearrangement, tertiary alcohol
description: The reaction of a tertiary alcohol with hydrazoic acid with rearrangement to form an imide.

label: heteroaryl N-alkylation
description: An N-alkylation reaction where the reactive centre is an azacycle ring nitrogen.

label: Goldberg reaction
description: A coupling reaction in which an acetanilide is coupled to an aryl halide to give an N-acetyl diaryl amine in the presence of a copper compound.

label: Schmidt rearrangement, ketone
description: The reaction of a ketone with hydrazoic acid with the insertion of an NH group between the carbonyl carbon and one of the R groups to form an amide.

label: Claisen rearrangement
description: The [3,3]-sigmatropic rearrangement of an allyl vinyl ether to give a gamma,delta-unsaturated carbonyl compound.

label: Sarett primary alcohol oxidation
description: Oxidation of a primary alcohol with a pyridine-chromium trioxide complex to yield an aldehyde.

label: intermolecular acyloin condensation
description: A reductive coupling reaction between two ester groups in different molecules to give an acyloin (an alpha-hydroxyketone).

label: Neber rearrangement
description: The rearrangement of the sulfonic ester of a ketoxime in base to give an alpha-amino ketone.

label: amide N-alkylation
description: An N-alkylation where the reactive centre is an amide nitrogen.

label: Sarett secondary alcohol oxidation
description: Oxidation of a secondary alcohol with a pyridine-chromium trioxide complex to yield a ketone.

label: Claisen condensation
description: A carbon-carbon coupling reaction of an ester and a carbonyl compound to form a beta-keto ester.

label: Bamford-Stevens reaction
description: The reaction of a tosylhydrazone of an aldehyde or ketone with a strong base to give an olefin.

label: aniline N-alkylation
description: An N-alkylation where the reactive centre is an aniline nitrogen.

label: intramolecular acyloin condensation
description: A reductive coupling reaction between two ester groups in the same molecule to give an acyloin (an alpha-hydroxyketone).

label: Nazarov cyclisation
description: The acid-catalysed cyclisation of a divinylketone to give a cyclopentenone.

label: Chichibabin reaction
description: Reaction of an azacycle with an alkali-metal amide to yield an aminated azacycle.

label: Bogert-Cook synthesis
description: Condensation of beta-phenylethylmagnesium bromide with a cyclohexanone followed by cyclisation and dehydration in concentrated sulfuric acid to yield an octahydrophenanthrene.

label: Claisen condensation
description: A carbon-carbon coupling reaction of an ester and a carbonyl compound to form a beta-keto ester.

label: pinacol rearrangement
description: A rearrangement of a 1,2-diol to give a carbonyl compound, catalysed by acid.

label: intramolecular Scholl reaction
description: Scholl reaction within a single molecule to form a larger ring system.

label: Emde degradation
description: A reduction of a quaternary ammonium salt containing at least one unsaturated substituent, to give a tertiary amine.

label: Ullmann condensation
description: A coupling reaction in which a phenol is coupled to an aryl halide to give a diaryl ether in the presence of a copper compound.

label: ortho-Fries rearrangement
description: Rearrangement of the acyl group in a phenolate ester to the ortho-position.

label: bicyclic Boulton-Katritzky rearrangement
description: Rearrangement of a mancude bicyclo[4.3.0] compound with an unsaturated two-heavy-atom substituent on the six-membered ring alpha to the bridgehead to form a new mancude bicyclo[4.3.0] compound where the five-membered ring has been formed from the two-heavy-atom substituent and the original five-membered ring has been broken.

label: Jones oxidation
description: An oxidation reaction where an alcohol is oxidized to the corresponding carbonyl compound by a dichromate ion.

label: polymerisation objective
description: A molecular transformation objective that is satisfied by a reaction in which a large number of monomers react together to product a polymer consisting of repeating units.

label: pivaloyl deprotection
description: A hydroxy group deprotection where a pivalate group is removed in acid or base conditions.

label: Dieckmann cyclisation
description: An intramolecular cyclisation of a diester to give a cyclic beta-ketoester.

label: ring-opening metathesis
description: A ring-breaking reaction in which two carbon-carbon double bonds are redistributed among two fragments, i.e. an alkene and a cycloalkene. It is typically catalysed by a metal carbenoid, and proceeds via two four-membered intermediates (metallacyclobutanes). The reaction is driven by release of ring strain in the cycloalkene.

label: Barton-McCombie deoxygenation
description: The deoxygenation of an alcohol to the corresponding alkane using a thiochloroformate. It proceeds by a radical mechanism.

label: haloethanoate ester-aldehyde Darzens reaction
description: A coupling of an aldehyde with an alpha-haloethanoate ester to form the next homologous aldehyde.

label: Algar-Flynn-Oyamada reaction
description: A fused-ring-system formation reaction where a flavonol is produced by oxidation of a chalcone with alkaline hydrogen peroxide.

label: Hantzsch pyridine synthesis
description: A ring-forming reaction between two equivalents of a beta-ketoester, an aldehyde and ammonia (or an ammonium salt), to give a dihydropyridine. The dihydropyridine can be oxidised to a pyridine using an oxidising agent.

label: Crabbé homologation
description: Oxidation of an alkene to an allene by heating with formaldehyde, an amine and an inorganic salt.

label: aza-Payne rearrangement
description: A base-catalysed isomerisation of a 2,3-epoxyamine to form a hydroxy aziridine, with inversion of configuration at C2.

label: Bohn-Schmidt reaction
description: Reaction of a hydroxylated anthraquinone with fuming sulfuric acid or sulfuric acid in boric acid in the presence of a mercury or selenium catalyst to form a more hydroxylated anthraquinone.

label: Béchamp reduction
description: Reduction of an aromatic nitro compound to the corresponding arene by iron in some form in aqueous acid.

label: Cope elimination
description: Elimination of a hydroxylamine from an amine oxide by pyrolysis to yield an olefin.

label: Duff reaction
description: Formylation of a phenol or aromatic amine with hexamethylenetetramine in acidic conditions.

label: Boc protection
description: A protection reaction in which an amine is converted into a tert-butoxycarbonyl compound.

label: Stille coupling
description: A carbon-carbon coupling reaction where a stannane reacts with an organohalide or organotriflate.

label: retro-aldol addition
description: The reverse of an aldol addition, in which a beta-hydroxy ketone fragments to form a carbonyl compound and the enolate of an alpha-acidic carbonyl compound.

label: Fischer-Hepp rearrangement
description: The rearrangement of an aromatic nitrosamine to a para-nitrosoaniline.

label: Sommelet-Hauser rearrangement
description: The [2,3]-sigmatropic rearrangement of a benzyl quaternary ammonium salt to form an aniline.

label: nitro-Michael reaction
description: A conjugate addition reaction where a carbon nucleophile adds to an alpha,beta-unsaturated nitro compound.

label: Noyori asymmetric hydrogenation, carbonyl
description: The homogeneous asymmetric catalytic hydrogenation of a carbonyl bond using a ruthenium(II) BINAP catalyst.

label: Clauson-Kaas reaction
description: A ring rearrangement reaction where an amine reacts with a 2,5-dialkoxytetrahydrofuran to give a pyrrole.

label: aza-Ferrier rearrangement
description: The rearrangement of an O-alkenyl hemiaminal ether to give the corresponding beta-amino carbonyl compound.

label: Yamaguchi lactonisation
description: The intramolecular esterification of a carboxylic acid group with an alcohol group using 2,4,6-trichlorobenzoyl chloride (Yamaguchi reagent) - an intramolecular Yamaguchi esterification.

label: Corey-Fuchs terminal dibromoolefination
description: Reaction of an aldehyde with tetrabromomethane and triphenylphosphine to yield a terminal dibromoolefin.

label: Biginelli reaction
description: A three-component coupling of a beta-keto ester, an aldehyde and urea to give a 3,4-dihydropyrimidinone.

label: enyne metathesis
description: A joining reaction in which a carbon-carbon double bond and a carbon-carbon triple bond are redistributed among two fragments, i.e. an alkene and an alkyne. It is typically catalysed by a metal carbenoid, and proceeds via two four-membered intermediates (metallacyclobutenes). As a low-MW alkene is not released, the reaction is usually driven by formation of a ring.

label: Monsanto process
description: The reaction of formaldehyde with methanol to form acetic acid, catalysed by a rhodium complex.

label: intramolecular Scholl reaction
description: Scholl reaction within a single molecule to form a larger ring system.

label: Phillips benzimidazole synthesis
description: Reaction of an ortho-diaminobenzene with a carboxylic acid under heat to yield a benzimidazole.

label: oxa-Pictet-Spengler reaction
description: Cyclisation-condensation of a beta-arylethanol with an aldehyde to yield an ortho-,peri-fused aryl-oxacycle.

label: Swern oxidation
description: The oxidation of a primary alcohol or secondary alcohol to an aldehyde or ketone respectively. Does not work with allylic or benzylic alcohols.

label: aza-Diels-Alder reaction
description: A Diels-Alder reaction between a diene and an imine or an azadiene and an alkene to give a six-membered nitrogen-containing ring compound.

label: aza-Achmatowicz rearrangement
description: A rearrangement of a furfuryl amine derivative to a tetrahydropyridinone.

label: Perkow reaction
description: The reaction between an alpha-halocarbonyl compound and a trialkyl phosphite to give an enol phosphate.

label: N-acylation to urea
description: An acylation reaction where a nitrogen atom is acylated to form a urea.

label: Zincke nitration
description: Substitution of phenol ortho- or para-bromo or iodo groups by a nitro group on treatment with nitrous acid or a nitrite in acetic acid.

label: Ing-Manske procedure
description: The reaction of primary alkyl halides with sodium or potassium phthalimide, followed by treatment with hydrazine, to give the corresponding primary amine.

label: palladium-catalysed Kumada coupling
description: A cross-coupling reaction between a Grignard reagent and an activated (aryl or vinyl) halide or triflate. The reaction is catalysed by a palladium catalyst.

label: Pfitzner-Moffatt oxidation
description: The oxidation of a primary or secondary alcohol to the corresponding aldehyde or ketone respectively using dimethyl sulfoxide, 1,3-dicyclohexylcarbodiimide and acid. The reaction proceeds via an alkoxysulfonium ylide.

label: Horner reaction
description: A joining reaction between a phosphine oxide and a carbonyl compound to give an olefin.

label: aza-Henry reaction
description: A carbon-carbon coupling reaction between a nitroalkane and an imine to give a beta-amino nitroalkane.

label: addition objective
description: A functional modification objective that is satisfied by a reaction in which two or more groups of atoms are added to the molecule, resulting in a change of skeletal bond order.

label: Bose-Mitsunobu reaction
description: A Mitsunobu reaction, where an alcohol is converted to something else with inversion at the stereocentre, using diphenylphosphoryl azide.

label: Yamaguchi lactonisation
description: The intramolecular esterification of a carboxylic acid group with an alcohol group using 2,4,6-trichlorobenzoyl chloride (Yamaguchi reagent) - an intramolecular Yamaguchi esterification.

label: ketone Barbier reaction
description: A joining reaction between an ketone and an alkyl halide or aryl halide or vinyl halide or allyl halide in the presence of metal to give a tertiary alcohol.

label: joining with rearrangement objective
description: A molecular skeleton joining objective that is satisfied by a reaction in which one or more atoms are added to the molecular skeleton and a skeletal rearrangement occurs.

label: Schmidt rearrangement, carboxylic acid
description: The reaction of a carboxylic acid with hydrazoic acid to give the lower homologue amine, with the loss of the terminal carbon atom.

label: Cannizzaro reaction
description: The disproportionation of a non-enolisable aldehyde to the corresponding carboxylic acid and alcohol. The reaction is base-catalysed.

label: Griess reaction
description: A diazotisation that proceeds by the addition of nitrous acid, nitric acid and water, resulting in a diazonium nitrate salt.

label: Bouveault-Blanc reaction
description: The reduction of an ester using sodium to give two alcohols.

label: Feist-Bénary synthesis
description: Reaction of an alpha-haloketone or alpha-haloether with a 1,3-dicarbonyl compound in the presence of pyridine to yield a substituted furan.

label: Tishchenko reaction
description: The formation of an ester from two aldehydes via a disproportionation process using a metal alkoxide to oxidise one aldehyde and reduce the other.

label: Sakurai reaction, epoxide
description: A ring-breaking reaction in which an epoxide reacts with allyltrimethylsilane to form a hydroxy alkene.

label: Madelung indole synthesis
description: Reaction of an N-(2-alkylphenyl)alkanamide with strong base to form an indole.

label: Rupe rearrangement
description: Rearrangement of a propargyl alcohol to an alpha,beta-unsaturated carbonyl compound via an enyne intermediate to yield the beta-substituted product.

label: Barton reaction
description: The photolytic oxidation of a nitrate ester to give a gamma-nitroalcohol.

label: Appel bromination with bromine
description: Conversion of an alcohol to an alkyl bromide with triphenylphosphine and bromine.

label: benzyl ether protection
description: A hydroxyl group protection where the hydroxyl oxygen atom is protected by formation of a benzyl ether.

label: ring-closing enyne metathesis
description: A joining reaction in which a carbon-carbon double bond and a carbon-carbon triple bond in the same molecule are redistributed to give a alkene-substituted cycloalkene. It is typically catalysed by a metal carbenoid, and proceeds via two four-membered intermediates (metallacyclobutanes). The reaction is driven by formation of the ring.

label: ring-closing metathesis
description: A joining reaction in which two carbon-carbon double bonds in the same molecule are redistributed to give a cycloalkene. It is typically catalysed by a metal carbenoid, and proceeds via two four-membered intermediates (metallacyclobutanes). The reaction is driven by release of a low-MW alkene.

label: Reimer-Tiemann reaction
description: A formylation reaction between an aromatic compound (for example, phenol, pyrrole or indole) and chloroform (for example, to form an ortho-formyl phenol).

label: molecular ring rearrangement objective
description: A molecular transformation objective that is satisfied by a reaction in which the number of skeletal rings in a molecule stays the same but the connectivity of the atoms in at least one ring changes.

label: Sakurai reaction, acetal or ketal
description: A carbon-carbon coupling reaction in which an acetal or ketal reacts with allyltrimethylsilane to form a homoallylic ether.

label: Biginelli reaction
description: A three-component coupling of a beta-keto ester, an aldehyde and urea to give a 3,4-dihydropyrimidinone.

label: Kolbe electrolysis
description: The decarboxylation and coupling of a carboxylate or mixture of carboxylates to give a dimer.

label: Barbier-Wieland degradation
description: The degradation of a carboxylic acid to its next lower homologous carboxylic acid.

label: hydroformylation
description: The reaction of hydrogen and carbon monoxide with an alkene, to give an aldehyde, catalysed by a rhodium or cobalt catalyst. The process is equivalent to the formal addition of the H-C bond of formaldehyde across the double bond of an alkene.

label: tert-butyl ester deprotection
description: A deprotection reaction where the reactant is a tert-butyl ester and the product is a carboxylic acid.

label: molecular ring expansion objective
description: A molecular transformation objective that is satisfied by a reaction in which an existing skeletal ring is increased in size.

label: reductive imination
description: A functional group modification where a carbonyl oxygen is replaced by an imine.

label: oxy-Cope rearrangement
description: A [3,3]-sigmatropic rearrangement of a 3-hydroxy-1,5-hexadiene rearranges to form a 5,6-unsaturated carbonyl compound.

label: Prilezhaev epoxidation
description: Epoxidation of an alkene by reaction with a peroxy acid.

label: Suzuki-Miyaura coupling
description: The coupling of a boronic acid or boronic ester with an unsaturated halide, triflate or sulfonate catalysed by a palladium(0) complex.

label: Knorr quinoline synthesis
description: Synthesis of an alpha-hydroxyquinoline by reaction of a beta-ketoester and an arylamine then dehydration with concentrated sulfuric acid.

label: Shapiro reaction
description: The reaction of a tosylhydrazone of an aldehyde or ketone with an alkyllithium or Grignard reagent to give an olefin.

label: alkyne-azide click reaction
description: A [3+2] cycloaddition reaction between an azide and an alkyne to give a 1,2,3-triazole, needing only heat to proceed.

label: Paal-Knorr thiophene synthesis
description: The cyclisation of a 1,4-dicarbonyl compound with phosphorus pentasulfide to give a thiophene.

label: Boc deprotection
description: An amino group deprotection reaction where a tertbutoxycarbonyl group is removed in acid conditions.

label: Dakin-West reaction
description: The reaction of an amino acid with an acid anhydride to give an alpha-acylamido ketone. The reaction proceeds via the mixed anhydride and an oxazolone; the product is always racemic.

label: Pinner pyrimidine synthesis
description: Reaction of a 1,3-dicarbonyl compound with an amidine to yield a pyrimidine.

label: nitrile to acid conversion
description: A functional group modification where a nitrile is transformed into a carboxylic acid.

label: carboxylic acid to primary alcohol reduction
description: A carboxylic acid reduction where the product is the corresponding primary alcohol.

label: nitrile reduction to amine
description: A reduction where a nitrile is replaced by an amine function.

label: Skraup reaction
description: A condensation between an aromatic amine and glycerol to give a quinoline.

label: Fleming-Tamao oxidation
description: The stereospecific oxidation of a (phenyldimethylsilyl)alkane to the corresponding alcohol using bromine, usually generated in situ from potassium bromide and peracetic acid.

label: [1,2]-aza-Wittig rearrangement
description: A base-mediated 1,2-sigmatropic rearrangement of a tertiary amine to give a secondary amine.

label: Betti reaction
description: Reaction of a phenol, an aromatic aldehyde and a primary aromatic or heterocyclic amine to yield a Betti's base, also known as an alpha-aminobenzylphenol.

label: Bergman cyclisation
description: The cyclisation of an ene-diyne to give a 1,4-diradical cyclohexatriene. The diradical usually aromatises.

label: monocyclic Boulton-Katritzky rearrangement
description: Rearrangement of an azapentacycle containing a -N= system where there is an unsaturated three-heavy-atom substituent XYZ on the substituent double-bonded to the nitrogen, to a new azapentacycle where the pivotal nitrogen has broken its single bond and formed a new bond with atom Z.

label: Bergmann azlactone peptide synthesis
description: Reaction of an acetylated amino acid with an aldehyde then with a second amino acid, then hydrogenation and hydrolysis to form a dipeptide. It proceeds via an azlactone intermediate.

label: Fetizon oxidation
description: The oxidation of a primary alcohol to an aldehyde or a secondary alcohol to a ketone using Fetizon's reagent.

label: imino-Reformatsky reaction
description: A carbon-carbon coupling reaction where an imine reacts with a alpha-halo ester and zinc to form a beta-amino ester.

label: Julia olefination
description: A carbon-carbon coupling reaction between a phenyl sulfone and an aldehyde or ketone to give a (typically trans) alkene.

label: Wolff-Kishner reduction, Huang-Minlon modification
description: The reduction of an aldehyde or ketone to the corresponding methylene compound, using hydrazine hydrate and a base in refluxing ethylene glycol.

label: Bouveault aldehyde synthesis
description: Reaction of an organomagnesium or organolithium compound with an N,N'-disubstituted formamide to yield the next homologous aldehyde.

label: Corey-Fuchs reaction
description: A homologation reaction of an aldehyde to yield a terminal alkyne. The reagents are tetrabromomethane, triphenylphosphine, butyllithium and water.

label: Bart reaction
description: Reaction of an aromatic diazonium compound with an alklai arsenite in the presence of copper or silver to yield an aromatic arsonic acid.

label: Knorr pyrazole synthesis
description: Synthesis of a pyrazole by condensation of a 1,3-dicarbonyl compound with a hydrazine, hydrazide, semicarbazide or aminoguanidine.

label: Bodroux reaction
description: Reaction of a carboxylic ester with a magnesium iodide alkylamide to yield a carboxamide.

label: Paal-Knorr pyrrole synthesis
description: The cyclisation of a 1,4-dicarbonyl compound with an amine to give a pyrrole.

label: Vilsmeier-Haack reaction
description: A formylation of an activated arene with a disubstituted formamide to give an aryl carboxaldehyde.

label: Sharpless asymmetric dihydroxylation
description: The dihydroxylation of an alkene to give an alpha,beta-diol, with control of absolute stereochemistry at the two new stereocentres. The oxidising agent is osmium tetroxide, which is used catalytically with a stoichiometric oxidant and a chiral ligand. The reagents are available commercially as AD-mix.

label: Baker-Venkataraman rearrangement
description: The base-catalysed rearrangement of an o-acetoxyacetophenone to give a hydroxyphenyl-1,3-diketone.

label: Kolbe-Schmitt reaction
description: The (predominantly ortho) carboxylation of a phenoxide.

label: alkyne-azide click reaction
description: A [3+2] cycloaddition reaction between an azide and an alkyne to give a 1,2,3-triazole, needing only heat to proceed.

label: Payne rearrangement
description: A base-catalysed isomerisation of a 2,3-epoxyalcohol, with inversion of configuration at C2.

label: [2,3]-aza-Wittig rearrangement
description: A base-mediated 2,3-sigmatropic rearrangement of an activated tertiary allyl amine, to give a secondary homoallylic amine.

label: Pictet-Spengler reaction
description: A condensation-cyclisation of a beta-phenethylamine with an aldehyde to give a tetrahydroisoquinoline.

label: ene reaction
description: A joining reaction where an alkene with an allylic hydrogen reacts with a compound containing a multiple bond (an enophile) to form a substituted alkene.

label: benzilic acid rearrangement
description: A rearrangement of a 1,2-diketone to an alpha-hydroxy carboxylic acid. It can also be applied to alpha-keto aldehydes. The first exmaple of this reaction was with benzil (PhC(=O)C(=O)Ph) to form benzilic acid, hence the name.

label: Sommelet reaction
description: The oxidation of a benzylic halide to give an aldehyde. The reaction uses hexamethylenetetramine.

label: Yamamoto polymerisation
description: The nickel-catalysed carbon-carbon coupling of a dihaloaromatic compound or aromatic bistriflate to give a polymer.

label: Ireland-Claisen rearrangement
description: The enolisation and subsequent [3,3]-sigmatropic rearrangement of an allylic acetate to give a gamma,delta-unsaturated carboxylic acid.

label: Zemplen transesterification
description: The reduction of an ester to the corresponding alcohol, using sodium methoxide in dry methanol.

label: hydroboration-oxidation
description: The formal addition of water across a double bond of an alkene or alkyne by formation of an organoborane and in situ oxidation, typically with basic peroxide. The product is usually the less substituted alcohol.

label: Tsuji-Trost reaction
description: A carbon-carbon coupling reaction in which a nucleophile reacts with an allyl acetate, allyl halide, allyl carbonate, allyl carbamate, allyl phosphate, allyl sulfone or allyl nitro compound to give an allyl compound. The reaction is catalsed by Pd(0).

label: Menshutkin reaction
description: The alkylation of a tertiary amine with an alkyl halide to the corresponding ammonium salt.

label: Staudinger reaction
description: A joining of an organic azide and a tertiary phosphine to give a phosphazo compound.

label: Dess-Martin oxidation
description: The oxidation of a primary alcohol to an aldehyde or a secondary alcohol to a ketone using the Dess-Martin periodinane.

label: Boyland-Sims oxidation
description: The oxidation of an aromatic amine to give a (predominantly ortho) amino aryl sulfate using potassium persulfate followed by hydrolysis to yield the corresponding aminophenol.

label: Johnson-Claisen rearrangement
description: The coupling and subsequent [3,3]-sigmatropic rearrangement of an allylic alcohol and trimethyl orthoacetate to give a gamma,delta-unsaturated alkyl ester.

label: oxa-Diels-Alder reaction
description: A Diels-Alder reaction between a diene and an aldehyde or ketone to give a six-membered oxygen-containing ring compound.

label: Criegee oxidation
description: The oxidative cleavage of an alpha,beta-diol using lead tetraacetate to give the corresponding carbonyl compounds.

label: Seyferth-Gilbert-Bestmann homologation
description: Seyferth-Gilbert aldehyde homologation where the Seyferth-Gilbert reagent is generated in situ by reaction with methanol and potassium carbonate.

label: malonic ester synthesis
description: A carbon-carbon coupling reaction between a dialkyl malonate and an alkyl halide, to give a substituted acetic acid. The base/R'X treatment can be repeated to give a disubstituted product.

label: Kolbe-Schmitt reaction
description: The (predominantly ortho) carboxylation of a phenoxide.

label: Rosenmund-von Braun reaction
description: A carbon-carbon coupling reaction where an aryl halide reacts with copper(I) cyanide to give an aryl nitrile.

label: Rosenmund reduction
description: The hydrogenolysis of an acyl halide to the corresponding aldehyde, catalysed by palladium-on-barium sulfate.

label: photohydrosilylation
description: The photochemically induced addition of a hydrosilane across the double bond of an alkene or alkyne to give a more substituted silane, usually applied to cases where the hydrosilane is part of a silicon surface. The reaction uses UV irradiation and is usually initiated by an added photoactive compound such as a platinum catalyst.

label: Arndt-Eistert reaction
description: A homologation reaction of a carboxylic acid to give the homologated carboxylic acid via acyl chloride and diazoketone intermediates.

label: Kharasch reaction
description: The transfer of a hydrogen or halogen atom from a haloalkane to an alkene, giving the chain-extended halogenated alkane.

label: Nicholas reaction, nucleophilic carbon centre
description: The reaction of a propargylic cation (stabilised with dicobalt octacarbonyl) with a nucleophilic carbon centre (on e.g. enolates, allyl silanes, ketones, electron-rich aromatics, beta-dicarbonyl compounds) to give a substituted alkyne.

label: Strecker degradation
description: The deamination and decarboxylation of amino acids to imines and then to aldehydes or ketones, in the presence of a carbonyl compound (especially an alpha,beta-dicarbonyl compound or a reducing sugar such as glucose). The reaction is involved in the generation of meat aromas/flavours in cooking.

label: Still-Gennari modification
description: A Horner-Wadsworth-Emmons reaction that uses phosphonates with electron-withdrawing groups and dissociating conditions to produce predominantly Z-olefins.

label: N-acylation to amide
description: An acylation reaction where a nitrogen atom is acylated to form an amide.

label: Benkeser reduction
description: Addition of hydrogen atoms to unsaturated rings by means of alkali metals in low-molecular weight amines.

label: Balz-Schiemann reaction
description: The conversion of an aromatic amine to the corresponding fluoride via the diazonium fluoroborate.

label: Gattermann reaction
description: The formylation of an arene with hydrogen cyanide to give an aryl aldehyde or ketone.

label: benzoin condensation
description: A reaction between two aromatic aldehydes to give a benzoin (an alpha-hydroxyketone).

label: Criegee oxidation
description: The oxidative cleavage of an alpha,beta-diol using lead tetraacetate to give the corresponding carbonyl compounds.

label: O-acylation to ester
description: An O-acylation reaction where an oxygen centre is acylated to result in an ester.

label: Ugi reaction
description: Reaction of a ketone or aldehyde, amine, an isocyanide and carboxylic acid to form a bisamide.

label: Fischer-Speier esterification
description: The esterification of a carboxylic acid with an alcohol. Various Lewis acids or Bronsted acids may be used as catalyst.

label: Nicholas reaction, nucleophilic carbon centre
description: The reaction of a propargylic cation (stabilised with dicobalt octacarbonyl) with a nucleophilic carbon centre (on e.g. enolates, allyl silanes, ketones, electron-rich aromatics, beta-dicarbonyl compounds) to give a substituted alkyne.

label: Birch reduction
description: Addition of hydrogen atoms to aromatic rings by means of alkali metals in liquid ammonia.

label: Sakurai reaction, epoxide
description: A ring-breaking reaction in which an epoxide reacts with allyltrimethylsilane to form a hydroxy alkene.

label: Nozaki-Hiyama-Kishi reaction
description: A coupling reaction of an aldehyde to an allyl, vinyl or aryl halide or triflate in the presence of chromium(II). It is catalysed by nickel.

label: haloethanoate ester-aldehyde Darzens reaction
description: A coupling of an aldehyde with an alpha-haloethanoate ester to form the next homologous aldehyde.

label: Eschenmoser-Claisen rearrangement
description: The coupling and subsequent [3,3]-sigmatropic rearrangement of an allylic alcohol and alpha,alpha-dialkoxy ethylamine to give a gamma,delta-unsaturated dialkyl amide.

label: benzylamine deprotection
description: An amino group deprotection reaction where a benzylamine group is removed by hydrogenation.

label: molecular skeleton insertion objective
description: A molecular skeleton joining objective that is satisfied by a reaction in which one or more atoms are added to the middle of a chain.

label: protection objective
description: A functional modification objective that is satisfied by protecting some functional group.

label: Appel iodination
description: Conversion of an alcohol to an alkyl iodide with triphenylphosphine and tetraiodomethane.

label: Willgerodt reaction
description: The conversion of an aryl alkyl ketone to an amide and/or an ammonium salt of a carboxylic acid using ammonium polysulfide. The carbonyl group of the product is always at the end of the alkyl chain.

label: 1,4-hydrovinylation
description: The reaction of a 1,3-diene with an alkene to give a 1,4-diene, usually employing a cobalt-based catalyst (see Hilt and Luers, Synthesis, 2002, 609).

label: Demjanov rearrangement
description: Substitution reaction of a primary amine via deazotisation to yield a mixture of the corresponding primary alcohol and secondary alcohol.

label: Larock indole synthesis
description: Palladium-catalysed synthesis of a 2,3-substituted indole by reaction of an ortho-iodoaniline with an internal alkyne.

label: semidine rearrangement
description: A rearrangement of a p-substituted hydrazobenzene to give a p-aminodiphenylamine.

label: Paternò–Büchi reaction
description: A photochemical cycloaddition between an aldehyde or ketone and an alkene to give an oxetane.

label: Vorbrueggen condensation
description: The substitution of an acylated sugar with a silylated base to give a nucleoside.

label: Mumm rearrangement
description: Rearrangement of an acyl imidate to form a carboximide.

label: Grob fragmentation
description: The fragmentation of a molecule that takes place when an electron-donating fragment (X) and an electron-accepting fragment (X') are situated at positions 1 and 3 on an aliphatic chain, to give a cationic fragment, a neutral fragment (e.g. an alkene) and an anionic fragment.

label: benzidine rearrangement
description: A rearrangement of a hydrazobenzene to give a diaminobiphenyl compound.

label: Ullmann reaction
description: A carbon-carbon homocoupling reaction of an aryl halide mediated by copper.

label: cyclic alpha-haloketone Favorskii rearrangement
description: Base-catalysed rearrangement of a cyclic alpha-haloketone to the ring-contracted cyclic carboxylic acid.

label: Leuckart aldehyde reaction
description: Reductive amination of an aldehyde with ammonium formate or formamide to form an amine.

label: Paal-Knorr furan synthesis
description: The cyclisation of a 1,4-dicarbonyl compound with an acid catalyst to give a furan.

label: Edman degradation
description: A cleaving reaction in which a peptide is treated with phenylisothiocyanate, removing the terminal amino acid group, to form the chain-shortened amine and a phenylthiohydantoin.

label: nitrile alcoholysis
description: An oxidation reaction where a nitrile reacts with an alcohol to form an alkyl imidate.

label: alkyne metathesis
description: A joining reaction in which two carbon-carbon triple bonds are redistributed among two fragments, i.e. two alkynes. It is catalysed by a metal carbenoid, and proceeds via two four-membered intermediates (metallacyclobutenes). The reaction is driven by release of a low-MW alkyne.

label: Chichibabin pyridine synthesis
description: Reaction of carbonyl compounds with ammonia or an amine to yield a pyridine.

label: Aufbau reaction
description: The insertion of alkenes (usually ethene) into the Al-C bond of an aluminium alkyl, to give a long-chain aluminium alkyl that can go on to react again, or can decompose into the corresponding terminal alkene. The addition of transition metals results in reliable production of high molecular weight polymers.

label: carboxylic acid to acid chloride conversion
description: A functional group modification where a carboxylic acid is converted to an acid chloride.

label: Clauson-Kaas reaction
description: A ring rearrangement reaction where an amine reacts with a 2,5-dialkoxytetrahydrofuran to give a pyrrole.

label: seleno-Pummerer rearrangement
description: The conversion of a selenoxide with an alpha-hydrogen to an alpha-subtituted selenoether.

label: Lindgren oxidation
description: The oxidation of an aldehyde to a carboxylic acid with chlorite.

label: Fritsch-Buttenberg-Wiechell rearrangement
description: The rearrangement of a 2-bromoalkene into an alkyne, mediated by strong base.

label: benzylamine protection
description: An amino group protection where the amino nitrogen atom is protected by reaction with benzylamine.

label: Sandmeyer halogenation
description: An aromatic substitution reaction where an aryl diazonium salt reacts with a copper(I) halide to form an aromatic halide.

label: molecular substitution objective
description: A molecular transformation objective that is satisfied by a reaction in which one singly-bonded substituent, but not a hydrogen, is replaced by another singly-bonded substituent.

label: hydrotelluration
description: The reaction of a organotellurium hydride with an alkyne, to give a (usually (Z)-configured) vinyltellurium species.

label: hydroamination
description: The addition of the N-H bond of an amine across a double bond of an alkene or alkyne, to give a more substituted amine.

label: Knoevenagel condensation
description: A carbon-carbon coupling reaction of an aldehyde and a methylene compound.

label: Gattermann chlorination
description: A Gattermann halogenation where the aryl diazonium salt reacts with copper powder and hydrochloric acid to yield an aromatic chloride.

label: Stevens rearrangement, sulfonium
description: The 1,2-rearrangement of an alpha-methylene sulfonium salt to a sulfide in the presence of strong base.

label: Algar-Flynn-Oyamada reaction
description: A fused-ring-system formation reaction where a flavonol is produced by oxidation of a chalcone with alkaline hydrogen peroxide.

label: Wolff rearrangement
description: A rearrangement of a diazoketone to give a ketene, with the elimination of molecular nitrogen.

label: MacDonald condensation
description: The reaction between a 1,9-diformyldipyrromethane and a dipyrromethane to give a porphodimethene.

label: Bellus-Claisen rearrangement
description: The coupling and subsequent [3,3]-sigmatropic rearrangement of an allylic ether or allylic thioether or allylic amine and a ketene to give the corresponding gamma,delta-unsaturated carbonyl compound.

label: intermolecular Scholl reaction
description: Scholl reaction between two aromatic molecules to form a single molecule.

label: Ritter reaction
description: A reaction between an alcohol or alkene and a nitrile to give an amide, catalysed by a Bronsted acid.

label: Appel bromination with tetrabromomethane
description: Conversion of an alcohol to an alkyl bromide with triphenylphosphine and tetrabromomethane.

label: Grignard reaction
description: A carbon-carbon coupling reaction where a Grignard reagent reacts with a compound containing an electrophilic carbon atom. A Grignard reagent is a magnesium-stabilised carbon nucleophile. An aldehyde leads to a secondary alcohol, a ketone leads to a tertiary alcohol, an ester leads to a ketone and a nitrile leads to a ketone.

label: Sharpless asymmetric epoxidation
description: The epoxidation of an allylic alcohol to give a beta,gamma-epoxy alcohol, with control of absolute stereochemistry at the two new stereocentres. The oxidising agent is tert-butyl hydroperoxide, and the catalyst is a complex of titanium salt and optically active diethyl tartrate.

label: Oppenauer oxidation
description: An oxidation of a secondary alcohol to a ketone involving an equilibrium between the alcohol and a reagent ketone present in excess, catalysed by a metal alkoxide.

label: Tebbe olefination
description: Reaction of an aldehyde or ketone or carboxylic ester or amide with the Tebbe reagent to yield an olefin or an enol ether or an enamine.

label: Zincke nitration
description: Substitution of phenol ortho- or para-bromo or iodo groups by a nitro group on treatment with nitrous acid or a nitrite in acetic acid.

label: N-acylation to carbamate
description: An N-acylation reaction where a nitrogen centre is acylated to form a carbamate.

label: Stork-Wittig olefination
description: A carbon-carbon coupling reaction where an aldehyde reacts with a phosphonium salt to give a Z-iodoalkene. The reaction is mediated by sodium or potassium hexamethyldisilazide.

label: molecular ring breaking objective
description: A molecular skeleton transformation objective that is satisfied by a reaction where the product has fewer rings than the reactants.

label: Cope rearrangement
description: A [3,3]-sigmatropic rearrangement where a 1,5-hexadiene rearranges to form a 1,5-hexadiene.

label: Saegusa oxidation
description: Reaction of silyl enol ethers with palladium acetate in acetonitrile to yield an alpha,beta-unsaturated ketone.

label: Barton-Zard reaction
description: Reaction of a nitroalkene with an alpha-isocyanoacetate to yield a substituted pyrrole.

label: Sonogashira coupling
description: A carbon-carbon coupling reaction where a terminal alkyne reacts with an aryl halide to give an aryl alkyne. It is catalysed by palladium.

label: Polonovski-Potier reaction
description: The reaction of a tertiary amine oxide with trifluoroacetic anhydride to give an N,N-disubstituted acetamide and an aldehyde.

label: 1-aza-Cope rearrangement
description: The rearrangement of a delta,epsilon-unsaturated imine to form a 3-aza-1,5-hexadiene.

label: silyl protection
description: A hydroxyl group protection where the hydroxyl oxygen atom is protected by formation of a silyl ether.

label: Glaser coupling
description: A coupling reaction between two molecules of a terminal alkyne catalysed by Cu(I) salts.

label: hydroboration
description: The addition of a boron hydride across a double bond of an alkene or alkyne. The boron usually adds to the less substituted carbon.

label: Eschweiler-Clarke methylation
description: N-methylation of a primary or secondary amine with formic acid and formaldehyde to yield a tertiary amine.

label: intramolecular Scholl reaction
description: Scholl reaction within a single molecule to form a larger ring system.

label: alkene reduction to alkane
description: A hydrogenation reaction where an alkene is reduced to an alkane.

label: Sonogashira coupling
description: A carbon-carbon coupling reaction where a terminal alkyne reacts with an aryl halide to give an aryl alkyne. It is catalysed by palladium.

label: interrupted Nazarov cyclisation
description: Cyclisation of a propargyl alpha,beta-unsaturated ketone where the reactant rearranges to an allenyl vinyl ketone, followed by a Nazarov cyclisation in which a nucleophile 'intercepts' the intermediate carbocation to yield a cyclopentenone substituted at the alpha position opposite the double bond.

label: Strecker reaction
description: An addition reaction between a carbonyl compound, an inorganic cyanide and an ammonium salt, followed by hydrolysis, to give an alpha-amino carboxylic acid.

label: para-Fries rearrangement
description: Rearrangement of the acyl group in a phenolate ester to the para-position.

label: functional oxidation objective
description: A functional group modification objective that is satisfied by a reaction in which a functional group is oxidised.

label: Gattermann bromination
description: A Gattermann halogenation where the aryl diazonium salt reacts with copper powder and hydrobromic acid to yield an aromatic bromide.

label: Tamao oxidation
description: The stereospecific oxidation of a (halosilyl)alkane to the corresponding alcohol using potassium fluoride and hydrogen peroxide.

label: Ireland-Claisen rearrangement
description: The enolisation and subsequent [3,3]-sigmatropic rearrangement of an allylic acetate to give a gamma,delta-unsaturated carboxylic acid.

label: heteroaryl N-arylation
description: An N-arylation reaction where the reactive centre is an azacycle ring nitrogen.

label: Swern oxidation
description: The oxidation of a primary alcohol or secondary alcohol to an aldehyde or ketone respectively. Does not work with allylic or benzylic alcohols.

label: metalla-aza-Claisen rearrangement
description: The rearrangement of a 3-aza-4-metalla-1,5-hexadiene to form a delta,epsilon-unsaturated metallaimine.

label: Japp-Klingemann reaction
description: The reaction of a doubly activated methylene compound that has at least one carbonyl substituent with an aryl azide to give a hydrazone. Usually there is concomitant cleaving and oxidation of one of the carbonyl substituents.

label: intermolecular Scholl reaction
description: Scholl reaction between two aromatic molecules to form a single molecule.

label: molecular fragmentation objective
description: A molecular transformation objective that is satisfied by a reaction in which the parent molecule breaks up into three or more products.

label: Quelet reaction
description: Reaction of an aliphatic aldehyde with a phenolic ether and hydrochloric acid to yield an alpha-chloroalkylphenolic ether.

label: Friedel-Crafts acylation
description: A carbon-carbon coupling reaction between an arene and a carbonyl compound (usually an acyl halide) to give an aryl ketone. The reaction is catalysed by a Lewis acid.

label: nitro reduction to amine
description: A reduction reaction where a nitro group is reduced to an amino group.

label: Bischler-Napieralski reaction
description: A cyclodehydration of a beta-phenethylamide to give a 3,4-dihydroisoquinoline.

label: Sharpless asymmetric epoxidation
