description: The epoxidation of an allylic alcohol to give a beta,gamma-epoxy alcohol, with control of absolute stereochemistry at the two new stereocentres. The oxidising agent is tert-butyl hydroperoxide, and the catalyst is a complex of titanium salt and optically active diethyl tartrate.

label: Bischler-Möhlau indole synthesis
description: Reaction of a terminal hydroxyketone or terminal halogenoketone with an aromatic amine to yield a 2-substituted indole.

label: thiol-ene reaction
description: The addition of a thiol across the double bond of an alkene to give a thioether.

label: molecular rearrangement objective
description: A molecular transformation specification that specifies that the number of rings and number of skeletal atoms should be preserved and that one or more atoms or groups of atoms move from one atom to another.

label: haloethanoate ester-ketone Darzens reaction
description: A coupling of a ketone with an alpha-haloethanoate ester to replace the oxo group with a formyl group.

label: Menshutkin reaction
description: The alkylation of a tertiary amine with an alkyl halide to the corresponding ammonium salt.

label: Allan-Robinson isoflavone synthesis
description: Reaction of ortho-hydroxyaryl ketones with aromatic carboxylic acid anhydrides to yield an isoflavone.

label: Pauson-Khand reaction
description: A [2+2+1] cycloaddition between an alkyne, an alkene and carbon monoxide to form an alpha-beta-unsaturated cyclopentenone.

label: aromatic Claisen rearrangement
description: The [3,3]-sigmatropic rearrangement, and subsequent re-aromatisation, of an allyl aryl ether to give an ortho-allyl phenol.

label: Hofmann reaction
description: Conversion of a primary carboxylic amide to the lower homologue primary amine. The first step is the Hofmann rearrangement

label: Nef synthesis
description: Reaction of an aldehyde or ketone with a sodium acetylide to yield a propargyl alcohol.

label: aldehyde Barbier reaction
description: A joining reaction between an aldehyde and an alkyl halide or aryl halide or vinyl halide or allyl halide in the presence of metal to give a secondary alcohol.

label: Cadogan coupling
description: The arylation of an arylamine mediated by isopentyl nitrite.

label: Knorr pyrazole synthesis
description: Synthesis of a pyrazole by condensation of a 1,3-dicarbonyl compound with a hydrazine, hydrazide, semicarbazide or aminoguanidine.

label: oxy-Cope rearrangement
description: A [3,3]-sigmatropic rearrangement of a 3-hydroxy-1,5-hexadiene rearranges to form a 5,6-unsaturated carbonyl compound.

label: cyclic alpha-haloketone Favorskii rearrangement
description: Base-catalysed rearrangement of a cyclic alpha-haloketone to the ring-contracted cyclic carboxylic acid.

label: Chan-Lam coupling
description: Arylation of an amine or an alcohol with an arylboronic acid, stannane or siloxane in air with a copper acetate catalyst.

label: methyl ester deprotection
description: A deprotection reaction where the reactant is a methyl ester and the product is a carboxylic acid.

label: Chugaev reaction
description: Elimination of a water molecule from a secondary alcohol to yield an olefin.

label: Zweifel diene synthesis
description: The carbon-carbon homocoupling reaction of a pair of alkyne molecules using a borane and iodine. The reaction proceeds via a borane intermediate.

label: Robinson annulation
description: Reaction of a cyclohexanone with methyl vinyl ketone to form a fused-ring cyclohexenone. It is a Michael reaction followed by an intramolecular aldol condensation.

label: Borsche-Drechsel cyclisation
description: Rearrangement of a cyclohexanone phenylhydrazone followed by oxidation to yield a carbazole.

label: alcohol oxidation to carboxylic acid
description: An alcohol oxidation where the alcohol centre is replaced with a carboxy group.

label: oxa-Pictet-Spengler reaction
description: Cyclisation-condensation of a beta-arylethanol with an aldehyde to yield an ortho-,peri-fused aryl-oxacycle.

label: palladium-catalysed Kumada coupling
description: A cross-coupling reaction between a Grignard reagent and an activated (aryl or vinyl) halide or triflate. The reaction is catalysed by a palladium catalyst.

label: Schmidt rearrangement, alkene
description: The reaction of an alkene with hydrazoic acid with rearrangement to form an imide.

label: Bellus-Claisen rearrangement
description: The coupling and subsequent [3,3]-sigmatropic rearrangement of an allylic ether or allylic thioether or allylic amine and a ketene to give the corresponding gamma,delta-unsaturated carbonyl compound.

label: Blaise reaction
description: The coupling of an alpha-bromo ester with a nitrile to give a beta-ketoester, in the presence of zinc.

label: Meerwein-Ponndorf-Verley reduction
description: A reduction of an aldehyde or ketone to an alcohol involving an equilibrium between the aldehyde or ketone and a reagent alcohol present in excess, catalysed by a metal alkoxide. This reaction is the reverse of the Oppenauer oxidation (RXNO:0000047).

label: molecular skeleton elimination objective
description: A functional modification objective that is satisfied by a reaction in which two or more groups of atoms are removed from the molecule, resulting in a change of skeletal bond order.
